snippet: GlaxoSmithKline plans to cut costs in its struggling European drugs division and promised investors a return to growth this year.
abstract: GlaxoSmithKline plans to cut costs in its struggling European drugs division and promises investors a return to growth in 2013; reports fourth-quarter profit of 839 million pounds ($1.35 billion), down 35 percent from 1.28 billion pounds in year-ago quarter; revenue fell 3 percent to 6.80 billion pounds.
lead_paragraph: GlaxoSmithKline plans to cut costs in its struggling European drugs division and promised investors a return to growth this year.

headline.seo: After Posting Lower Profit, Glaxo to Cut Costs
headline.main: Glaxo Plans to Cut Costs to Offset Weak Sales
headline.print_headline: Glaxo Plans To Cut Costs To Offset Weak Sales
